sub_title: Lecturer and researcher AUAS ★ Focus on sustainability in sports and fan experience ★ Social scientist ★ Entrepreneur
summary: Experienced researcher and lecturer with a demonstrated history of working in the sports industry. My specialization lies in (legacies of) mega sports events and in adapted sports. Constantly eager to learn new things and keep life interesting. Which has eventually resulted in a string of long stays abroad (Brazil) and the founding of several businesses. One of my slogans: 'I just want to do cool things'.

profile_positions.location: Domain Sports and Nutrition, Dr. Meurerlaan 8 Amsterdam
profile_positions.description:
➤ 2021/2022
Researching: impact of FIH WC Hockey 2022, sustainability of and safety within sports within the Fieldlab Reimagine Sports project
Lecturer in: World of Sport and Consultancy Skills Working Groups
Coach of: A first years class and individual third and fourth years students.
Thesis supervision of: several students.

➤ 2020/2021
Researching impact of: EURO2020.
Lecturer in: International Events.
Coach of: A first years class and individual third and fourth years students.
Thesis supervision of: several students.

➤ 2019/2020
Co-establishing: a research group within the Faculty.
Researching impact of: EURO2020.
Lecturer in: International Events.
Coach of: A first years class and individual third and fourth years students.
Thesis supervision of: several students.
Grading: Dutch and English research topics due to the absence of two colleagues.

➤ 2018/2019
Lecturer in: International Events and Professional Orientation (part of minor Sport for Development) .
Researching impact of: FIBA3x3 World Championships of 2019 and the 2019 UEC Road European Championships.
Coach of: A first years class and individual third and fourth years students.
Thesis supervision of: 8 students.

➤ 2017/2018
As a lecturer I am responsible for two courses:
➤ Research 2 - a course which focuses on writing a research paper based on literature.
➤ International events - a course which highlights three topic's (bid procedure, sustainability and legacy) all related to Mega Sport Events.

As a researcher I am (partly) responsible for a social impact study on two sports events:
➤ De Coolste Baan van Nederland. 
➤ The ISU World Championship Allround speed skating.

In this position I am furthermore responsible for thesis supervision.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer and researcher

profile_positions.description:
The Name Is Data (TNID) is specialized in data analysis and story telling and as such is devoted to translate data into insightful ways which support strategic decision making and enable predicting analyses. 

Our current focus is on predicting future fitness results and we are organizing an online fitness challenge to test the MVP of our web portal and gather data.
profile_positions.title: Partner

profile_positions.description:
Clients and project summaries 2019:
➤ Dirk Kuyt Foundation, 

Clients and project summaries 2018:
➤ Dirk Kuyt Foundation, developing the TOPFIT program, a free and online sports program for people with a disability.
➤ Leiden Asia Centre, analyzing social and physical accessibility in Koriyama and Tokio, Japan. Writing an academic article based on the research findings and presenting the outcomes on international conferences/ workshops.

profile_positions.title: Founder

profile_positions.description:
➤ As of January 2018 I am responsible for the roll-out of two projects. One will focus on an increase in physical and social accessibility of gym's throughout Holland, in order to ensure more inclusion of athletes with a disability. The second project encompasses the development of a national sports/ activity program for people with a disability. This program is called TOPFIT and has been launched on the 19th of September 2018.

➤ As of October 2017 until December 2017 I have conducted an impact research on the activities of the Foundation. I have used questionnaires in order to create a picture of the impact the Foundation has on adapted sports events in the Netherlands and on the experiences of the participants of these events.
profile_positions.title: Project Lead

profile_positions.description:
As of June 2016 I have been working on a self-funded PhD research project. The objective of this research is to analyse how Paralympic Games contribute to social inclusion of disabled people in a host country.  I have identified that the event can lead to changes in four legacy domains: infrastructure, political, social and sport. Positive changes in these domains can lead to a decrease in barriers and as such can have a direct effect on social inclusion of the target group.

At the moment I am not enrolled at a university, however prof. dr. Ramon Spaaij is the promotor of this research. Formerly, my promotor was prof. dr. Koen Breedveld.

Currently have already presented my study at:
➤ The European Association for Spot Management in Bern in 2017
➤ The Day of national Sports research in Zwolle in 2017 

Currently have already written the following published materials:
➤ A short essay on female Brazilian Paralympians.
➤ An article on the effects of the Paralympic Games of Rio de Janeiro on social inclusion of people with a disability.

Unfortunately I was unable to get the following article published yet, however it has the potential according to the editors of Disability and Society:
➤ An academic article on Paralympic legacies of Sydney 2000, Beijing 2008 and London 2012.
profile_positions.title: External (self-funded) PhD candidate

profile_positions.description:
A description of what MyNextDestination stands for will follow soon.

➤ Institutional relations
➤ Content writer
profile_positions.title: Founder and CEO

profile_positions.description:
During a time-period of five months the Mulier Instituut, a Dutch Centre for Research on Sports in Society, assigned me to be the eyes and ears in Rio de Janeiro right after the Olympic Games of 2016. 
My main tasks were to:
➤ Identify and evaluate the legacy of the mega sports event
➤ Gather information from literature published by the media and research institutions 
➤ Conducted interviews with specialists on related topics

The end product of this temporary assignment was a chapter in an academic publication on the Olympic Games. The chapter is written by three different authors and  I am first author.
profile_positions.title: Affiliate researcher

profile_positions.description:
During the first two months of my appointment I followed the Sogeti/ Ohio Business Course and the Basic course of Sogeti in the Netherlands. These courses provided knowledge on: 
➤ Information Technology
➤ Unified Project Management
➤ MS Project
➤ Lean Management
➤ Communicative skills 
➤ Presenting
➤ Development of business cases
➤ High performance teaming

In the position of Project Management Officer I have provided support to an ING programme called 4Sight. For more information please see the position below.
profile_positions.title: Young Professional Project Management Office

profile_positions.description:
Within ING I have worked for the Financial Department on a programme called 4Sight. This programme entails around 30 (inter)national projects which are managed centrally by the Senior Management. I worked for the Project Management Office, an organ with a supportive function towards the Senior Management. My core tasks were to improve: 
➤ Governance and decision making 
➤ Transparency by providing the right information to the right people 
➤ Delivery support by a reduction in bureaucracy  
➤ Reusability of lessons learned
➤ Traceability of information. 

To achieve these results within 4Sight the PMO-team covers various services. I was responsible for the following: 
➤ Communication Management
➤ The Reporting Cycle
➤ Deliverable Management
➤ Meeting Services 
➤ Time Booking.
profile_positions.title: Project Management Officer

volunteer_experiences.description: As a black belt instructor in Taekwon-Do I trained young trainers of KISPORT Martial Academy in new and creative training methods. I followed seminars of 'Tijd voor Vechtsport' in order to create more knowledge on a playful approach on Taekwon-Do classes.
